thread.title: BA's first Dreamliner to fly to Delhi
thread.title_full: BA's first Dreamliner to fly to Delhi

title: BA's first Dreamliner to fly to Delhi
text:
BA's first Dreamliner to fly to Delhi 13 July 2015 Save 
British Airways will use its first Boeing 787-9 Dreamliner to fly to Delhi five times a week. 
Launching on October 25, the service will operate on Mondays, Wednesdays, Thursdays, Saturdays and Sundays, departing from Heathrow. 
And while economy fares will lead in at £632pp, they are on sale for £516 return until midnight, July 14. 
The flight will also offer World Traveller Plus from £902, Club World from £2,184 and First Class from £3,270 and which will have only eight seats. 
The Dreamliner will be the first of 42 which have been ordered by the airline once it starts operating.
